channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Bank of England cuts rates again, citing Trump tariff tensions and slower growth
item.description: The BoE cuts rates to 4.25%, citing tariff-driven growth fears, even as it lifts UK GDP forecasts and inflation pressures ease.

item.title: How Lead Edge Capital’s 750-strong army of backers powers its venture flywheel
item.description: Nimay Mehta on the New York VC firm’s unique approach to software investing.

item.title: An Entertainment Tax
item.description: Why Hollywood recently got the Trump tariff treatment.

item.title: The Democratic Senator Taking Cues From Trumpism
item.description: Senator Chris Murphy argues voters want to know who’s screwing them.

item.title: How the Gates Foundation quietly changed American education: From algebra classes to smaller schools
item.description: Using data-driven insights, a tech-industry-derived focus on return on investment, and public-facing advocacy, the Gates Foundation has nudged school ...

item.title: A’ja Wilson Now Has a Nike Signature Shoe. Why Did It Take So Long?
item.description: The marketability of A’ja Wilson offers a case study in race, fame and gender.

item.title: Hochul, Looking to 2026, Pushed to Weaken Oversight of Religious Schools
item.description: Changing a law that chiefly affects all-boys Hasidic Jewish schools, known as yeshivas, has been a top priority among leaders of New York’s Hasidic co...

item.title: Mistrial in Murder Case Against Michigan Officer Who Shot Motorist
item.description: The jury deadlocked in the trial of Christopher Schurr, who testified that he feared for his life when he fatally shot Patrick Lyoya during a traffic ...

item.title: Why CHROs have the reputation of being the least AI-savvy of the C-suite
item.description: Most CEOs believe their top HR leaders aren’t as well-versed in AI as other prominent leaders.

item.title: It’s the end of philanthropy as we know it—and that could reshape America
item.description: America is a generous nation—and the pullback in government spending could be an opportunity to reshape its charitable sector.

item.title: After black smoke at noon, the crowd in St. Peter’s hopes for white smoke at night.
A convent asks people to spiritually adopt a voting cardinal.
Mississippi Man Is Charged With Stalking Jennifer Aniston
item.description: Prosecutors said that Jimmy Wayne Carwyle, 48, drove through the front gate of Ms. Aniston’s home on Monday after stalking her for nearly two years.

item.title: A call for ‘unity’ in the conclave sounds divisive to some.
